# Vedic Principles Coverage (Master Catalog)

To ensure scientific completeness, this report references a shared **Vedic Principles Catalog** derived from classical Jyotish texts. Computable indicators are evaluated quantitatively; non-computable principles are documented for transparency and future extensibility. [@bphs; @varahamihira_brihat_samhita; @saravali; @jataka_parijata; @surya_siddhanta]

```{python}
#| label: gold-vedic-catalog-counts
#| fig-cap: "Vedic Principles Catalog: Counts by Family"
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 4
#| fig-pos: 'H'

from pathlib import Path
import os
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

root = Path(os.getenv("QUARTO_PROJECT_DIR") or Path.cwd())
catalog = pd.read_csv(root / "data" / "vedic_principles_catalog.csv")

counts = catalog.groupby("family").size().sort_values(ascending=False).head(20)
plt.figure(figsize=(8.5, 4))
counts.plot(kind="bar", color="seagreen")
plt.ylabel("Count")
plt.title("Top Vedic Principle Families")
plt.grid(axis="y", alpha=0.3)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```

```{python}
#| label: tbl-gold-vedic-coverage
#| tbl-cap: "Coverage Matrix for Gold Report"

coverage = pd.read_csv(root / "data" / "vedic_principles_coverage.csv")
gold_cov = coverage[coverage["report"] == "gold"]
summary = (
    gold_cov.groupby(["family", "scope", "coverage_status"])
    .size()
    .unstack(fill_value=0)
    .reset_index()
)
summary["coverage_ratio"] = summary.get("computed", 0) / summary[[c for c in ["computed", "documented", "not_included"] if c in summary]].sum(axis=1)
summary.sort_values(["scope", "family"])  
```
